courses.course_description: Introduction to athletic training skills. Clinical observation hours required. Graded on A-F basis only.
courses.prerequisites: Restricted to Pre-Athletic Training majors only

courses.course_description: Continuation of athletic training skills. Graded on A-F basis only.
courses.prerequisites: Pre-Athletic Training majors; Completion of ATHTRN 1100 with minimum grade of B-

courses.course_description: Organized study of selected topics in Athletic Training. Subjects and earnable credit may vary from semester to semester.
courses.prerequisites: Instructor's consent

courses.course_name: Principles and Fundamentals of Athletic Training
courses.course_description: Introduces students to the common principles and fundamentals associated with the profession of athletic training.  Graded on A-F basis only.
courses.prerequisites: Restricted to Pre-Athletic Training majors

courses.course_description: The first in a sequence of practical/clinical experiences under the direct supervision of a Preceptor. Graded on A-F basis only.
courses.prerequisites: Restricted to Athletic Training majors; ATHTRN 1100, ATHTRN 1200, and ATHTRN 2100

courses.course_description: The second in a sequence of practical/clinical experiences under the direct supervision of a Preceptor. Graded on A-F basis only.
courses.prerequisites: Restricted to Athletic Training majors; Completion of ATHTRN 2150 with minimum grade of B-

courses.course_description: Analysis of the structure and function of cells, tissue, and organ systems. Emphasis is placed on the muscular, skeletal, and nervous systems as they relate to human movement. Graded on A-F basis only.
courses.prerequisites: Restricted to Pre-Athletic Training majors only

courses.course_description: Study of the human body utilizing cadaver specimens. Special emphasis will be placed upon the skeletal, muscular and nervous systems. Graded on A-F basis only.
courses.prerequisites: Restricted to Athletic Training majors; Completion of ATHTRN 2500 with a minimum grade of C

courses.course_description: Investigation into the structure, function, physiology, and biochemistry of the cardiovascular, lymphatic, respiratory, digestive, urinary, endocrine, and reproductive systems. Graded on A-F basis only.
courses.prerequisites: Restricted to Athletic Training majors only; Completion of ATHTRN 2500 with a minimum grade of C

courses.course_description: Study of psychosocial strategies, mental health referral policies and clinical application to athletic training. Graded on A-F basis only.
courses.prerequisites: Restricted to Athletic Training majors; PSYCH 1000

courses.course_description: The third in a sequence of practical/clinical experiences under the direct supervision of a Preceptor. Graded on A-F basis only.
courses.prerequisites: Restricted to Athletic Training majors only; Completion of ATHTRN 2250 with a minimum grade of B-

courses.course_description: Study of therapeutic modalities utilized in the treatment and rehabilitation of athletic injuries. Graded on A-F basis only.
courses.prerequisites: Restricted to Athletic Training majors; Completion of ATHTRN 2250 with a minimum grade of B-

courses.course_description: The fourth in a sequence of practical/clinical experiences under the direct supervision of a Preceptor. Graded on A-F basis only.
courses.prerequisites: Restricted to Athletic Training majors; Completion of ATHTRN 3150 with a minimum grade of B-

courses.course_description: A systematic approach to injury evaluation of the lower extremity and spine. Graded on A-F basis only.
courses.prerequisites: Restricted to Athletic Training majors; Completion of ATHTRN 2100 with a minimum grade of B- and ATHTRN 2500 and ATHTRN 2550 with a minimum grade of C

courses.course_description: A systematic approach to injury evaluation of the upper extremity, spine and head.  Graded on A-F basis only.
courses.prerequisites: Restricted to Athletic Training majors; Completion of ATHTRN 3300 with a minimum grade of B-

courses.course_description: Study of rehabilitation principles and techniques used to return active individuals to their sport/activity. Graded on A-F basis only.
courses.prerequisites: Restricted to Athletic Training majors; Completion of ATHTRN 3200 with a minimum grade of B-

courses.course_description: Examines the organizational and administrative aspects of Athletic Training. Graded on A-F basis only.
courses.prerequisites: Restricted to Athletic Training majors

courses.course_description: Examination of illness and disease found within the athletic population. Course graded on A-F basis only.
courses.prerequisites: Restricted to Athletic Training majors only, Completion of ATHTRN 3150 with a minimum grade of B-

courses.course_description: The fifth in a sequence of practical/clinical experiences under the direct supervision of a Preceptor. Graded on A-F basis only.
courses.prerequisites: Restricted to Athletic Training majors; Completion of ATHTRN 3250 with a minimum grade of B-

courses.course_description: The sixth in a sequence of practical/clinical experiences under the direct supervision of a Preceptor. Graded on A-F basis only.
courses.prerequisites: Restricted to Athletic Training majors; Completion of ATHTRN 4150 with a minimum grade of B-

courses.course_name: Nutrition for Athletic Performance and Rehabilitation
courses.course_description: Nutritional study examining how nutrition impacts sports performance.  Graded on A-F basis only.
courses.prerequisites: Restricted to Athletic Training majors; PH_THR 4420

courses.course_description: Capstone senior athletic training course. Graded on A-F basis only.
courses.prerequisites: Restricted to Athletic Training majors; Completion of ATHTRN 3250 with a minimum grade of B-

courses.course_name: Seminar in Athletic Training - Writing Intensive
courses.course_description: Capstone senior athletic training course. Graded on A-F basis only.
courses.prerequisites: Restricted to Athletic Training majors; Completion of ATHTRN 3250 with a minimum grade of B-
